lines.text: Where's the roast?
I'll go get it.
The roast is resting in a shallow unmarked grave in the backyard.
Oh. Well, there's plenty of other stuff.
Are you vegetarians?
Sometimes. It depends on the guest.
We've got some big guns and some big-big guns but I'm afraid I'm all out of big-big ammo!
The basement. You'll love it! It's like a cave. With a pool table.
He walked into our kitchen and was eating out of our refrigerator. I thought we was gonna eat me, but he ate our daughter's corsage and our passiflora coccinea, then it ate our goldfish!
And, uh, where is he now, Mr. Henderson?

[hearing the toilet flush in the backgrond]
In the bathroom.
Oh, of *course*, how stupid of me...!

[on the phone]
No, no, no Bigfoot here, Sergeant. I was just joking. It's just a prank, uh, I'm not even George Henderson. You must have reached the wrong number.
[hangs up]
We're on our own.
I'm gonna say this once. 'Gonna say it simple. And I hope to God for your sakes you all listen. There are no Abominable Snowmen. There are so Sasquatches. There are no Bigfeet!
[the family begins to giggle. Unbeknownst to Wrightwood, Harry is standing right behind him]
Am I missing something?
So what you're saying is you would be willing, excuse me, Jack would be willing to take in this creature and care for it and love it like a pet?
No, like a member of the family.
George, if I could have a word with you before The Carson Show calls?
Freeze! Move out! Drop it!
Are you crazy? Do you know how much I paid for this gun?
You've seen hundreds, thousands of pigeons, right?
Of course.
Have you ever seen a baby pigeon? Well, neither have I. I got a hunch they exist.
I have a friend and his name is, um, Jack and let's say there's... this... giant...
Is there a beanstalk involved in this, Mr. Henderson?
[looking in an anthropology book]
That's Jaques LaFleur, a hunter who came in the store today.
No, that's Richard Smith, the forestry guy who came to our... house today. That lying bastard!
Well, Jacques-o, what's next for you?
I don't know. There's always Loch Ness.
[Both laugh]
[the pool man just fished a hunk of Harry's hair out of the pool]
Do you have a cat?
No!
Good. Then it's just a hairball.
We don't even know what it is. We don't know if it's male or female.
Definitely male.
How can you tell?
[Sarah stares at them]
Oh, don't answer that, honey.

[Confused, looking at the multiple sets of bigfootprints in the snow made by the Hendersons and Dr Wallace Wrightwood]
It's a Goddamned herd!
Harry, sometimes you've just gotta wonder if there's any real difference between you and I. I mean, I can be pretty hairy too, you know.
[Groans]

I have no doubt that you saw him, but what really happened is when you saw him you were so scared shitless that you crashed your precious 10 Speeder into the stop sign, bumped your head on the curb and probably scared *him* half to the death in the process! All right, that's what really happened, isn't it? ISN'T IT?

[anguished]
Yes!

[whispering]
Hey, Dad, what if it's him?
Who?

[whispering]
Bigfoot.
Bigfoot...?
Holy shit! Sorry, Dad.
That's okay, I was looking for the right words.
I'm working with assholes.
I know what I'm talking about.
And I know it's closing time, so if you wanna talk shop, THEN SHOP!
Good morning, Seattle!
God, I hate this guy.
I'll turn it off.
No let me hate him. It'll keep me awake before the coffee kicks in.
Nan, don't you like roughing it in the wild?
Roughing it? George, the only thing rough about it was when the generator went out in the middle of Masterpiece Theatre.
I need someone to talk to! You know it hasn't been easy with this pool and everything, and Herb is no help! His latest theory is that a condor flew over and took a shit in it.
Shoot it!
It's dead.
Shoot it anyway!

We both spent our whole lives chasing after that beast and we both had to stare at ourselves in the mirror every morning and keep repeating, "I am not a fool. I am not a fool." Only you finally BLUNK.
I finally opened my eyes.

[climbs in his truck]
We'll find out soon enough.
[drives away]
Go for it, Jacques-o! Raise a ruckus. God knows I can use the business.
I wanted King Kong, you brought me a goddamn giant gerbil. I told you exactly what to do. You didn't even come close.
Maybe it's right on the nose. Maybe it's not vicious at all, Maybe it's gentle and has feelings.
Where'd you dream up that shit?
I'm not going to stand around while some animal destroys our house.
Dad, he's not an animal!
I didn't really mace him, I was about to be eaten!
Eaten? BY A VEGETARIAN?
[George has just hung up on Sgt. Mancini when suddenly the phone rings]
No, no, Sergeant. No Bigfoot here. Irene!

[to Nancy, about Harry]
It could be out there suffering. And I know you'd want to help me find it so I could ki-... care for it.
[LaFleur is released from the watch house]
Where the hell have you been?
There was nothing I could do!
Oh, bullshit!
They weren't letting anybody out until they processed those guns, and there were a lot of guns! You need a bath.
And what, blow my cover?
[bangs on counter]
Come on, come on! Give me my piece!
Hey, when I'm ready, pal.
When he's ready...! Jerome, do something, hey!

[to woman on phone]
So, what's your sign?
[George's father had changed George's kind drawing of Harry to make Harry look like a vicious monster]
See? You're not the only artist in the family. How's that for an arthritic old shooter, huh?
What the hell did you do that for? It's my drawing! Why'd you change it?
Cool down, George, it's just a piece of cardboard.
Not to me. It means something to me! Can't you see that he means something to me?
What the hell are you talking about?
The hell with it! I quit!
[Storms out]
Over this? You can't quit! We're too busy! Hey, what the hell's the matter with you?
I might be able to get you out sometime tonight, but I'm gonna need a damn good reason.
For Christ's sake, I'm talking about bagging a Sasquatch!
That'll cut a lot of ice for the judge.
Kim Chi!
[Storming to the garden]
Kim Chi! Kim CHI!
My name is Kim LEE, not Kim CHI!
You killed them!

[Notices the cut roses]
Oh, NO!
Where are my precious little babies?
What's your name, sir?
My name? My name is George He...
[notices the TV cameras]
George... George what?
George Hen...
George what?
Um... I'm sorry, I really have to leave.
[the press chases him to his car]

[Pins LaFleur against his car]
Listen to me. You're wrong. I was like you! I almost killed him myself. But it would've been murder. He's not an animal!
He's our friend!
For God's sake, Jacques-o, open your eyes.
Are you people out of your minds? You think I'm going to stop now? I'm going to kill him.

[Begins slamming LaFleur against the car]
You're not gonna kill him! You're not gonna hurt him! I won't let you! I'll kill you first...
[Harry pushes George and LaFleur apart]

[Pointing to George]
Don't let him kill me. Don't let him kill me.
[Blubbering]
Please don't let him kill me! Don't let him kill me, please don't...! Please don't let him kill me!

[sees enormous foot prints in the ground]
Harry.
Yeah?
Sorry. I thought you were somebody else.
Listen, you don't understand. I almost had him! I was THAT close.
Then what? Gun jam? Or maybe a change of heart? Had him in your sights and couldn't do it? What's the story this time?
I don't know. I think he was hit by a car.
Well, that should have made it easy.
Yes, I know. There were no traces. No tracks. Nothing, he just... vanished.
Well, like I tell my customers, Bigfoot eat their dead.
I don't know why the hell I bother with you.
Because you figure I'm the only one who wants to believe you deep down, but I don't. Not anymore.
I don't feel so good...
Pull over, Dad. She's gonna launch.
Ernest!
Hey, hey, careful of my drawings back there. And don't step on the trout!
Or my flowers, if they're still alive.
Or Mom's flowers.
Hey, Dad.
Yeah?
Do you think I could get a pair of real Major League baseball cleats when we get back?
You bet.
Great. I'm gonna spike Frankie McDowell.
Oh no you're not.
Listen to your mom, Ern.
But he spiked me twice.
Well that's different. You go right ahead then.
George!
Nan, you don't understand these things. It's just smart baseball.

[after trapping Jacques LeFleur on the freeway]
That sucker's history!
Don't kid yourself. This is the part he's good at.
Nancy, I'm not a doctor, but it's got no pulse, it's not breathing and it's cold as a Popsicle. Believe me, honey, whatever he is, he's definitely dead!
[trying to goad Harry into the car to return him to the wild]
Well, here we are. Remember this? Your favourite station wagon.

[unsuccessfully straightening the wrecked front bumper]
Or what's left of it...
